closeSettingsDialogMessage: You must close the Settings page before opening a .btpt file.
openFileErrorDialogMessage: The {{ path }} file is corrupted or the server doesn't have the read permissions.
importOutputTemplateDialogMessage: Do you want to import the {{ templateName }} template?
changelogDialogMessage: Please make you sure to update also the app on your smatphone.
welcomeStep1: 1) Install the app on your smartphone
welcomeStep2: 2) Launch the app and scan this QR code to connect
connectToWifi1: Make sure the smartphone is connected to the same Wi-Fi network as the computer.
sameNetworkTitle: Make sure it's the same network
sameNetwork1: Both the computer and the smartphone must be connected to the same Wi-Fi network.
sameNetwork2: The app connects using the LAN/WLAN network, it doesn’t matter if your computer has a wired connection as long as it's connected to the same access point.
check5GhzTitle: Check if it's 2.4 GHz or 5 GHz
check5Ghz1: Modern routers may create two separate networks.
check5Ghz2: You may need to allow communication between the two networks on the router page (usually http://192.168.1.1).
check5Ghz3: Alternatively, you can completely disable the 5 GHz Auto-join option on your mobile devices and use only 2.4 GHz that is better for long-distance communications.
checkFirewall1: Most {{ av }} software block local connections by default.
checkFirewall2: Try to temporarely pause it, and then when you determine what was causing the issue add {{ appName }} to your {{ av }} exceptions list.
checkFirewall5: The procedure may differ based on what {{ av }}  you have.
done1: At this point you should be able to connect the app to the server.
emptyScanSessionList2: Open the app and tap on the camera button to start scanning
keyboardEmualtionWarning1: Keyboard emulation is enabled by default.
keyboardEmualtionWarning2: To type barcodes in your programs minimize Barcode to PC and put the cursor inside a text field.
deleteAllDialogMessage: The scans sessions will be deleted from the server. You can send them again from your smartphone.
connectionExtablished: A connection was successfully established with {{ deviceName }}
accessibilityPermissionsDialogMessage:
In order to enable the "Keyboard emulation" feature, you must give {{ appName }} the Accessibility permissions.

Please make you sure that {{ appName }}:

• Is present in the allowed list
• And that it is checked
versionMismatchDialogMessage:
Please update both app and server, otherwise they may not work properly.

Server can be downloaded at {{ websiteName }}
mainMenuPopoverPair: Pair the app with QR code
qrCodePairInstructionsStep1: Open the app on your smartphone
qrCodePairInstructionsStep2.3: page by tapping the Wi-Fi shaped icon
automaticUpdatesDescription1: Warning: Disabling automatic updates you may encounter incompatibility issues.  Make you sure that at least the first number matches the one of the app.
rebuildDatabaseCacheDescription1: Updates the old scannings display value (it can take several minutes).
rebuildDatabaseCacheDescription2: Do it only if you know what your doing.
openAutomatically: Open {{ appName }} automatically after you log into the computer
enableKeyboardEmulationPopper1: Enable this option to automatically type the barcodes. Click
availableComponentsPopper1: To edit the emulated keyboard output drag
availableComponentsPopper8: If the key that you're looking for isn't present you can use the
availableComponentsPopper11: If you want to apply a custom function like a character replacement
availableComponentsPopper12: to uppercase, you can use the
limitReacheadHeader: You've reached the maximum number of output components
limitReachead1: Drag out one output component from the Output template
outputTemplatePopper1: It's the template that will be used to type barcodes with the emulated keyboard.
outputTemplatePopper2: You can rearrange the elements by dragging them. To remove an element drag it outside
outputTemplatePopper3: by keeping pressed your mouse button. Click
appendToCsvFilePopper1: Appends in real-time the scans to a .csv file. Click
appendToXlsxFilePopper1: Appends in real-time the scans to a .xlsx file. Click
variablesInfo: You can use the following variables in your file name (lowercase):
note1: To use the variables acquired from the smartphone it's required to put a correspoinding Output Component in the Output template field
note2: The timestamp variable refers to the scan session creation date
executeCommandLabel: Execute a command when the smartphone power cord is plugged in
maximumNumberOfScanSessionsDescription: The older scan sessions will be automatically deleted from the server, but you will still able to send them again from the smartphone using the sync button.
restoreDefaultSettingsDialogMessage: Do you really want to restore the default settings? This cannot be undone
syntaxErrorDialogMessage: The number of IF output components should be the same of the ENDIFs
unsavedSettingsDialogMessage: Do you want to save and apply the settings?
commercialUseDialogMessage: Your current license is for non-commercial use only. Please switch to a paid license if you are using Barcode to PC for commercial purposes
licenseActivatedDialogMessage: The license has been activated successfully
licenseActivationErrorDialogMessage: Unable to activate the license. Please make you sure that your internet connection is active and try again. If the error persists please contact the support.
licensePeriodicCheckErrorDialogMessage: Unable to verify your license. Please make you sure that the computer has an active internet connection
licenseDeactivationErrorDialogMessage: Unable to deactivate the license. Please make you sure that the computer has an active internet connection
deviceLimitsReachedDialogMessage: You've reached the maximum number of connected devices for your current license
scansLimitReachedDialogMessage: You've reached the maximum number of monthly scans for your current license.
numberComponentNotAvailableDialogMessage: The NUMBER component isn't available with your current license.
csvAppendNotAvailableDialogMessage: This feature isn't available with your current license.
skipOutputDescription:
Disables the Keyboard emulation and CSV output for this component.

This option is useful when you only want to acquire the data, and use it later with components like "JavaScript Function", "IF", "HTTP", or as a parameter for the CSV file name.
label: Label
numberDescription:
Provide a short description such as "Tracking number" or "Product ID".
The label will be shown in the app while acquiring the data.

Use the double curly braces syntax to inject a variables. Example:
{{ csv_lookup }}
availableVariables: You can use the following variables (lowercase)
defaultValueDescription:
The value that should be used when no input is provided.

Use the double curly braces syntax to inject variables. (Same as above)
filterDescription:
Define a regular expression to restrict the possible values of this Output Component.
It is recommended to use the "Multiple scans" mode when applying filters.
errorMessageDescription: The error message to show when the acquired value doesn't match the Filter regular expression
limitBarcodeFormatsDescription: Use this setting to keep enabled only the barcode formats that you scan. It may improve the scanning speed and the overall reliability. If this option is disabled the barcode formats specified in the app settings will be used.
modifierKeysDescription: Select the modifier keys that you want to be pressed along with the {{ outputBlock.name }} key
javascriptDescription1: The expression should return a string.
javascriptDescription2: You can manipulate the variables with any JavaScript method that is listed
millisecondsDescription:
Time interval to wait in milliseconds

1000 milliseconds = 1 second
urlDescription1: The expression must return a string.
urlDescription2: The request will be performed by the server once the scan is received.
urlDescription3: Use the double curly braces syntax to inject variables.
dataDescription1: Is the data to be sent as the request body. It must be a valid JSON string.
paramsDescription1: Are the URL parameters to be sent with the request. You can either pass them here or in the URL. It must be a valid JSON string.
headersDescription1: Are custom headers to be sent. It must be a valid JSON string.
commandDescription1: The working directory is set to the user home directory.
commandDescription2: Use the double curly braces syntax to inject variables.
commandTimeoutDescription: The maximum amount of time the process is allowed to run (milliseconds)
csvLookupDescription: CSV_LOOKUP allows you to match field values inside CSV files and then output the corresponding field value of another column.
searchValueDescription1: The text or number to search in the CSV file. You can use the variables listed below to search values coming from other components.
searchColumnIndexDescription: The column number (starting with 1 for the left-most column of the CSV file) that contains the searched value
resultColumnIndexDescription: The column number (starting with 1 for the left-most column of the CSV file) that contains the return value
notFoundValueDescription: The text to output when the lookup doesn't produce results
csvUpdateDescription:
CSV_UPDATE allows you to find and edit values inside CSV files.
If the operation is successful the new value will be outputted.
csvUpdateSearchDescription: The text or number to search in the CSV file. You can use the variables listed below to search values coming from other components.
newValueDescription: The text or number to use to replace the Search value in the CSV file. You can use the variables listed below to search values coming from other components.
csvUpdateSearchColumnIndexDescription: The column number (starting with 1 for the left-most column of the CSV file) where you want to search
csvUpdateNotFoundValueDescription: The text to output when the lookup doesn't produce results
beepDescription:
The beep sound will be played on the smartphone.
Make you sure that the smartphone Media volume is turned on.

Note: to disable the beep when you scan a barcode use the "Enable camera beep" option present in the app settings
title: Title
optionsListDescription:
Specify the possible options separed by the comma character

Use the double curly braces syntax to inject variables.
ifDescription1: The expression must return a boolean.
endifDescription: Use this component to close the IF component counterpart.
alertLeaveBlank: Leave blank to hide the button
timestampDescription: If you want a custom format use the DATE_TIME component instead.
customFormatDescription1: You can view the full token list
variablesInjectionInfoBox1: To access to the variables mentioned above you MUST put a corresponding Output Component in your Output Template that will assign a value to the variable.
